clinical_study.brief_title: The Prognosis of Acute Myocardial Infarction in Xinjiang

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to build a Xinjiang people registry and surveillance system for acute myocardial infarction(AMI) in2012-2015years to obtain real-world information about patient's basic information, patient characteristics, diagnostic test mode, the program of treatment and hospitalization outcomes including mortality, treatment complications, the cost of hospitalization and follow-up terminal events (death, major adverse cardiac events, minor adverse cardiovascular events)of xinjiang AMI patients; And to propose scientific precaution strategies aimed to prevent effectively from the incidence of AMI; And to optimize the management and outcomes of AMI patients through implementation of guideline recommendations in clinical practice, and analysis and development of effective treatment strategies; And to create cost-effective assessment system.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of the study is to establish the platform for surveillance, clinical research and translational medicine in Xinjiang , designed to provide a foundation for future quality improvement and research as well as facilitate efforts to improve the quality of AMI patient care , translate research into improved care for patients and thus decrease morbidity and mortality associated with AMI.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 38 months of follow-up deaths occurred during this period

secondary_outcome.measure: Major adverse cardiovascular events（cardiac death、 myocardial infarction again、target vessel revascularization、deterioration of cardiac function、readmission)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 38 months of follow-up major adverse cardiovascular events occurred during this period

study_pop.textblock: Acute myocardial infarction patients in hospitalized of The First Affiliated Hospital of Xinjiang Medical (include diagnosed acute ST-elevation or non ST-elevation myocardial infarction)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Acute myocardial infarction patients in hospitalized of The First Affiliated Hospital of Xinjiang Medical (include diagnosed acute ST-elevation or non ST-elevation myocardial infarction).Diagnosis criteria must meet Universal Definition for AMI (2012).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Myocardial infarction related to percutaneous coronary intervention

responsible_party.investigator_title: Xiangxie, MD,The First Affiliated Hospital Of XinJiang Medicial University
